answers.answer: Your doctor tells you. Later in your pregnancy, your baby may be breech (head up, feet down) or transverse (side to side) & some doctors/hospitals don't attempt to turn baby. Or you may have had a previous csection and are unable to VBAC (vaginal birth after cesarean). Umbilical cord could be wrapped around baby's neck, you could have preeclampsia. or any other medical problem that may affect baby.
Also, sometimes things come up. I had an emergency csection before.

question: How do you know if you have to have a c-section???
